Now gather<S>1413</S> thyself in troops<S>1416</S>, O daughter<S>1323</S> of troops<S>1416</S>: he hath laid<S>7760</S> siege<S>4692</S> against us: they shall smite<S>5221</S> the judge<S>8199</S> of Israel<S>3478</S> with a rod<S>7626</S> upon the cheek<S>3895</S>.
But thou, Bethlehem<S>1035</S> Ephratah<S>672</S>, though thou be little<S>6810</S> among the thousands<S>505</S> of Judah<S>3063</S>, yet out of thee shall he come forth<S>3318</S> unto me that is to be ruler<S>4910</S> in Israel<S>3478</S>; whose goings forth<S>4163</S> have been from of old<S>6924</S>, from everlasting<S>3117</S> <S>5769</S>. <sup>everlasting: Heb. the days of eternity</sup>
Therefore will he give them up<S>5414</S>, until the time<S>6256</S> that she which travaileth<S>3205</S> hath brought forth<S>3205</S>: then the remnant<S>3499</S> of his brethren<S>251</S> shall return<S>7725</S> unto the children<S>1121</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>.
And he shall stand<S>5975</S> and feed<S>7462</S> in the strength<S>5797</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, in the majesty<S>1347</S> of the name<S>8034</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> his God<S>430</S>; and they shall abide<S>3427</S>: for now shall he be great<S>1431</S> unto the ends<S>657</S> of the earth<S>776</S>. <sup>feed or, rule</sup>
And this man shall be the peace<S>7965</S>, when the Assyrian<S>804</S> shall come<S>935</S> into our land<S>776</S>: and when he shall tread<S>1869</S> in our palaces<S>759</S>, then shall we raise<S>6965</S> against him seven<S>7651</S> shepherds<S>7462</S>, and eight<S>8083</S> principal<S>5257</S> men<S>120</S>. <sup>principal: Heb. princes of</sup>
And they shall waste<S>7462</S> the land<S>776</S> of Assyria<S>804</S> with the sword<S>2719</S>, and the land<S>776</S> of Nimrod<S>5248</S> in the entrances<S>6607</S> thereof: thus shall he deliver<S>5337</S> us from the Assyrian<S>804</S>, when he cometh<S>935</S> into our land<S>776</S>, and when he treadeth<S>1869</S> within our borders<S>1366</S>. <sup>waste: Heb. eat up</sup> <sup>in the: or, with her own naked swords</sup>
And the remnant<S>7611</S> of Jacob<S>3290</S> shall be in the midst<S>7130</S> of many<S>7227</S> people<S>5971</S> as a dew<S>2919</S> from the LORD<S>3068</S>, as the showers<S>7241</S> upon the grass<S>6212</S>, that tarrieth<S>6960</S> not for man<S>376</S>, nor waiteth<S>3176</S> for the sons<S>1121</S> of men<S>120</S>.
And the remnant<S>7611</S> of Jacob<S>3290</S> shall be among the Gentiles<S>1471</S> in the midst<S>7130</S> of many<S>7227</S> people<S>5971</S> as a lion<S>738</S> among the beasts<S>929</S> of the forest<S>3293</S>, as a young lion<S>3715</S> among the flocks<S>5739</S> of sheep<S>6629</S>: who, if he go through<S>5674</S>, both treadeth down<S>7429</S>, and teareth in pieces<S>2963</S>, and none can deliver<S>5337</S>. <sup>sheep: or, goats</sup>
Thine hand<S>3027</S> shall be lifted up<S>7311</S> upon thine adversaries<S>6862</S>, and all thine enemies<S>341</S> shall be cut off<S>3772</S>.
And it shall come to pass in that day<S>3117</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, that I will cut off<S>3772</S> thy horses<S>5483</S> out of the midst<S>7130</S> of thee, and I will destroy<S>6</S> thy chariots<S>4818</S>:
And I will cut off<S>3772</S> the cities<S>6145</S> <S>5892</S> of thy land<S>776</S>, and throw down<S>2040</S> all thy strong holds<S>4013</S>:
And I will cut off<S>3772</S> witchcrafts<S>3785</S> out of thine hand<S>3027</S>; and thou shalt have no more soothsayers<S>6049</S>:
Thy graven images<S>6456</S> also will I cut off<S>3772</S>, and thy standing images<S>4676</S> out of the midst<S>7130</S> of thee; and thou shalt no more worship<S>7812</S> the work<S>4639</S> of thine hands<S>3027</S>. <sup>standing: or, statues</sup>
And I will pluck up<S>5428</S> thy groves<S>842</S> out of the midst<S>7130</S> of thee: so will I destroy<S>8045</S> thy cities<S>6145</S> <S>5892</S>. <sup>cities: or, enemies</sup>
And I will execute<S>6213</S> vengeance<S>5359</S> in anger<S>639</S> and fury<S>2534</S> upon the heathen<S>1471</S>, such as they have not heard<S>8085</S>.
